trans-unit.source: How to connect classic VNets to ARM VNets in Azure
trans-unit.target: How to connect classic VNets to ARM VNets in Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a VPN connection between classic VNets and new VNets
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a VPN connection between classic VNets and new VNets

trans-unit.source: Azure currently has two management modes: Azure Service Manager (referred to as classic), and Azure Resource Manager (ARM).
trans-unit.target: Azure currently has two management modes: Azure Service Manager (referred to as classic), and Azure Resource Manager (ARM).

trans-unit.source: If you have been using Azure for some time, you probably have Azure VMs and instance roles running on a classic VNet.
trans-unit.target: If you have been using Azure for some time, you probably have Azure VMs and instance roles running on a classic VNet.

trans-unit.source: And your newer VMs and role instances may be running on a VNet created in ARM.
trans-unit.target: And your newer VMs and role instances may be running on a VNet created in ARM.

trans-unit.source: In such situations, you will want to ensure the new infrastructure is able to communicate with your classic resources.
trans-unit.target: In such situations, you will want to ensure the new infrastructure is able to communicate with your classic resources.

trans-unit.source: You can do so by creating a VPN connection between the two VNets.
trans-unit.target: You can do so by creating a VPN connection between the two VNets.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to create a site-to-site (S2S) VPN connection between a classic VNet and an ARM VNet.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to create a site-to-site (S2S) VPN connection between a classic VNet and an ARM VNet.

trans-unit.source: This article assumes you already have classic VNets, and ARM VNets, and that you are familiar with configuring a S2S VPN connection for classic VNets.
trans-unit.target: This article assumes you already have classic VNets, and ARM VNets, and that you are familiar with configuring a S2S VPN connection for classic VNets.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed end-to-end solution on S2S VPN connectivity between classic and ARM VNets, visit <linkText>Solution Guide - Connect a classic VNet to and ARM VNet by using a S2S VPN</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a detailed end-to-end solution on S2S VPN connectivity between classic and ARM VNets, visit <linkText>Solution Guide - Connect a classic VNet to and ARM VNet by using a S2S VPN</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can see an overview of tasks to be done to create a S2S VPN connection between a classic VNet and an ARM VNet by using Azure gateways below.
trans-unit.target: You can see an overview of tasks to be done to create a S2S VPN connection between a classic VNet and an ARM VNet by using Azure gateways below.

trans-unit.source: 1 - <linkText>Create a VPN gateway for the classic VNet</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: 1 - <linkText>Create a VPN gateway for the classic VNet</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: 2 - <linkText>Create a VPN gateway for the ARM VNet</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: 2 - <linkText>Create a VPN gateway for the ARM VNet</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: 3 - <linkText>Create a connection between the gateways</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: 3 - <linkText>Create a connection between the gateways</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: To create the VPN gateway for the classic VNet, follow the instructions below.
trans-unit.target: To create the VPN gateway for the classic VNet, follow the instructions below.

trans-unit.source: Open the classic portal from https://manage.windowsazure.com, and enter your credentials, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Open the classic portal from https://manage.windowsazure.com, and enter your credentials, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: On the bottom left hand corner of the screen, click on the NEW button, then click NETWORK SERVICES, then click VIRTUAL NETWORKS, and then click ADD LOCAL NETWORK.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom left hand corner of the screen, click on the NEW button, then click NETWORK SERVICES, then click VIRTUAL NETWORKS, and then click ADD LOCAL NETWORK.

trans-unit.source: In the Specify your local network details window, type a name for the ARM VNet you want to connect to, and then on the bottom right hand corner of the window, click on the arrow button.
trans-unit.target: In the Specify your local network details window, type a name for the ARM VNet you want to connect to, and then on the bottom right hand corner of the window, click on the arrow button.

trans-unit.source: In the address space STARTING IP text box, type the network prefix for the ARM VNet you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: In the address space STARTING IP text box, type the network prefix for the ARM VNet you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: In the CIDR (ADDRESS COUNT) drop down, select the number of bits used for the network portion of the CIDR block used by the ARM VNet you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: In the CIDR (ADDRESS COUNT) drop down, select the number of bits used for the network portion of the CIDR block used by the ARM VNet you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: In VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS (OPTIONAL), type any valid public IP address.
trans-unit.target: In VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS (OPTIONAL), type any valid public IP address.

trans-unit.source: We will change this IP address later.
trans-unit.target: We will change this IP address later.

trans-unit.source: Then click on the checkmark button on the bottom right of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Then click on the checkmark button on the bottom right of the screen.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows sample settings for this page.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows sample settings for this page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Local netowrk settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Local netowrk settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the networks page, click on VIRTUAL NETWORKS, then click on your classic VNet, and then click on CONFIGURE.
trans-unit.target: On the networks page, click on VIRTUAL NETWORKS, then click on your classic VNet, and then click on CONFIGURE.

trans-unit.source: Under site-to-site connectivity enable the connect to the local network checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Under site-to-site connectivity enable the connect to the local network checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Select the local network you created in step 4 from the list of available networks from the LOCAL NETWORK drop down, and then click SAVE.
trans-unit.target: Select the local network you created in step 4 from the list of available networks from the LOCAL NETWORK drop down, and then click SAVE.

trans-unit.source: Once the settings are saved, click on DASHBOARD, then on the bottom of the page, click CREATE GATEWAY, then click DYNAMIC ROUTING, and then click YES.
trans-unit.target: Once the settings are saved, click on DASHBOARD, then on the bottom of the page, click CREATE GATEWAY, then click DYNAMIC ROUTING, and then click YES.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the gateway to be created and copy its public IP address.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the gateway to be created and copy its public IP address.

trans-unit.source: You will need it to setup the gateway in the ARM VNet.
trans-unit.target: You will need it to setup the gateway in the ARM VNet.

trans-unit.source: To create a VPN gateway for the ARM VNet, follow the instructions below.
trans-unit.target: To create a VPN gateway for the ARM VNet, follow the instructions below.

trans-unit.source: From a PowerShell console, switch to ARM mode by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: From a PowerShell console, switch to ARM mode by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Create a local network by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Create a local network by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: The local network must use the CIDR block of the classic VNet you want to connect to, and the public IP address of the gateway created in step 1 above.
trans-unit.target: The local network must use the CIDR block of the classic VNet you want to connect to, and the public IP address of the gateway created in step 1 above.

trans-unit.source: Create a public IP address for the gateway by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Create a public IP address for the gateway by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the subnet used for the gateway by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the subnet used for the gateway by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: The gateway subnet must already exist, and it must be named GatewaySubnet.
trans-unit.target: The gateway subnet must already exist, and it must be named GatewaySubnet.

trans-unit.source: Create an IP configuration object for the gateway by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Create an IP configuration object for the gateway by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Notice the id for a gateway subnet.
trans-unit.target: Notice the id for a gateway subnet.

trans-unit.source: That subnet must exist in the VNet.
trans-unit.target: That subnet must exist in the VNet.

trans-unit.source: The SubnetId and PublicIpAddressId parameters must be passed the id property from the subnet, and IP adress objects, repectively.
trans-unit.target: The SubnetId and PublicIpAddressId parameters must be passed the id property from the subnet, and IP adress objects, repectively.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use a simple string.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use a simple string.

trans-unit.source: Create the ARM VNet gateway by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Create the ARM VNet gateway by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Once the VPN gateway is created, retrieve its public IP address by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Once the VPN gateway is created, retrieve its public IP address by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Copy the IP address, you will need it to configure the local network for the classic VNet.
trans-unit.target: Copy the IP address, you will need it to configure the local network for the classic VNet.

trans-unit.source: Open the classic portal from https://manage.windowsazure.com, and enter your credentials, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Open the classic portal from https://manage.windowsazure.com, and enter your credentials, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: In the classic portal, scroll down and click NETWORKS, then click LOCAL NETWORKS, then click the ARM VNet you want to connect to, and then click on the EDIT button.
trans-unit.target: In the classic portal, scroll down and click NETWORKS, then click LOCAL NETWORKS, then click the ARM VNet you want to connect to, and then click on the EDIT button.

trans-unit.source: In VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS (OPTIONAL), type the IP address for the ARM VNet gateway retrieve in step 2 above, then click the right arrow on teh bottom right hand corner, and then click the checkmark button.
trans-unit.target: In VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS (OPTIONAL), type the IP address for the ARM VNet gateway retrieve in step 2 above, then click the right arrow on teh bottom right hand corner, and then click the checkmark button.

trans-unit.source: From a PowerShell console, switch to Azure Service Manager mode by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: From a PowerShell console, switch to Azure Service Manager mode by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Setup a shared key by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: Setup a shared key by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you change the names of the VNets to the your own VNet names.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you change the names of the VNets to the your own VNet names.

trans-unit.source: From a PowerShell console, switch to Azure Resource Manager mode by running the command below.
trans-unit.target: From a PowerShell console, switch to Azure Resource Manager mode by running the command below.

trans-unit.source: Create the VPN connection by running the commands below.
trans-unit.target: Create the VPN connection by running the commands below.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about <linkText>the Network Resource Provider (NRP) for ARM</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about <linkText>the Network Resource Provider (NRP) for ARM</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create an <linkText>end-to-end solution connecting a classic VNet to an ARM VNet by using a S2S VPN</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Create an <linkText>end-to-end solution connecting a classic VNet to an ARM VNet by using a S2S VPN</linkText><title></title>.
